newsitem.title: USA: Indonesia sets first natgas pipeline exports.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia sets first natgas pipeline exports.

text.p: Conoco Inc said Indonesia tentatively agreed to its first international sale of natural gas via pipeline to Singapore.

The first natural gas deliveries will begin by mid-year 2000 and will reach 325 million cubic feet of gas daily from West Natuna Sea production-sharing contract areas operated by Conoco, Gulf Canada Resources Ltd and Premier Oil Natuna Sea Ltd.
Work on the field development and the 300-mile pipeline is expected to begin in early 1998, the DuPont Co subsidiary said.
Conoco said a letter of agreement between Pertamina and Sembawang Engineering and Construction authorizes the export of 2.5 trillion cubic feet of Indonesian natural gas to Singapore.
The agreement, which represents Indonesia's first international sale of pipeline gas, is subject to the completion of the required detailed agreements, Conoco said.
